com.tapad.tapestry

Class TapestryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tapad.tapestry.TapestryService

  • public class TapestryService
extends java.lang.Object
    The TapestryService is a singleton (static) wrapper for the TapestryClient to provide one point of initialization. The service should be initialized in your application's onCreate() method. If you have no main Application then it must be initialized in every entry point of your app.

    The client sends a TapestryRequest as an HTTP request to the Tapestry Web API and parses the JSON response as TapestryResponse. When calling the client from the Android UI thread, it is recommended to send requests asynchronously by passing in a TapestryCallback so as not to block the UI thread.

    An example of sending a request and receiving an asynchronous response: 

     TapestryService.initialize(context);
 TapestryRequest request = new TapestryRequest();
 // TODO build request
 TapestryService.send(request, new TapestryCallback() {
     @Override
     public void receive(TapestryResponse response) {
         // TODO handle response
     }
 });
    Note if the callback updates the UI then you should use the TapestryUICallback convenience class which runs the callback on the UI thread. The client throws no exceptions unless Logging#setThrowExceptions(boolean) has been set to true.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(Context context)
        Creates client ready to receive requests. Client cannot be instantiated before onCreate is called. Partner id will be read from tapad.PARTNER_ID in the manifest or default if none exists. The url of the API will be read from tapad.API_URL in the manifest or default if none exists.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the app

      • client

        public static TapestryClient client()
        Get an instance of the underlying client. Throws a RuntimeException if not initialized.
        Returns:
        the Tapestry client

      • send

        public static void send(TapestryRequest request)
        Sends a request asynchronously using a worker thread pool, without returning a response.
        Parameters:
        request - The request

      • send

        public static void send(TapestryCallback callback)
        Sends a request asynchronously using a worker thread pool.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback that will be called when the Tapestry server responds

      • send

        public static void send(TapestryRequest request,
        TapestryCallback callback)
        Sends a request asynchronously using a worker thread pool.
        Parameters:
        request - The request
        callback - A callback that will be called when the Tapestry server responds

      • sendSynchronously

        public TapestryResponse sendSynchronously(TapestryRequest request)
        Sends a request synchronously, blocking until response is received.
        Parameters:
        request - The request
        Returns:
        a response from the server

      • optIn

        public static void optIn(Context context)
        Opts this device into tracking. Tapestry will collect ids and send requests from this app.

      • optOut

        public static void optOut(Context context)
        Opts this device out of all tracking. Tapestry will not be able to send requests from this app. All responses will be a TapestryResponse containing an TapestryError.OPTED_OUT error.
